Queen Elizabeth II has been on the thron: When did Queen Elizabeth II become queen? Queen Elizabeth II reign start date

On 6 February 1952, King George VI died following a prolonged illness and Princess Elizabeth immediately acceded to the throne, becoming Queen Elizabeth II and taking on all of the responsibilities which came with her new title.
When did Queen Elizabeth II become queen? Queen Elizabeth II reign start date

News. Elizabeth II (born April 21, 1926, London, England—died September 8, 2022, Balmoral Castle, Aberdeenshire, Scotland) was the queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland from February 6, 1952, to September 8, 2022.
